title.rendered: ‘People are disappointed because Gautam Gambhir hugged me’: Virat Kohli opens up on lack of ‘masala’.

content.rendered:
Virat Kohli is not in controversy during IPL 2024 and he is surprised by the public reaction towards him.

Last year, Virat Kohli was at the center of the biggest IPL storm. When his feud with Naveen-ul-Haq and Gautam Gambhir took the world by storm. The Kohli vs Naveen/Gambhir saga is the IPL 2023’s biggest controversy, drawing reactions from worldwide. It has ignited global interest and sparked intense cricketing debate, suspected to be the worst lineup in the history of IPL since Kohli v Gambhir Part 1 in 2013. Anger has grown, and the belief is that when the two former Indian teams will come face to face and later this year, the record will be set. 24 matches have been played and this IPL has been completed, but the season has been quiet so far. There haven’t been too many close finishes, or big individual clashes that have hampered Hardik Pandya’s reigning streak at Mumbai Indians. Kohli, who himself focuses on the game rather than on the field.. Shared his thoughts on the current state of cricket and expressed his surprise at the public’s reaction to his friendship with Gambhir.

Virat Kohli said

My behavior hurts people a lot. I hugged Naveen, the next day, Gauti bhai (Gautam Gambhir) came and hugged me. The masala is ready to be eaten. We are no longer children,” he said at an event organized by Asia Paints.

The Kohli vs Gambhir saga has been over the last year’s IPL. During the 2023 Asian Games, Gambhir apparently angered some of the crowd by chanting “Kohli-Kohli”. He later revealed that the reason for the move had nothing to do with Kohli but because someone called him an inappropriate name. People did not agree. During the Asia Cup in Sri Lanka, wherever Gambhir went, Kohli’s music taunted him. As Kohli said, Gambhir is not the only one to repair walls. In the 2023 World Cup in India, when the whole country is facing a confrontation between the two in the India vs Afghanistan match in Delhi. Kohli and Naveen removed the confusion, leaving the past and putting an end to everything that happened. . . Evening at the Ekana stadium in Lucknow.

Read Also: RCB players visit Siddhivinayak Mandir ahead of IPL clash vs MI.
